article_title: The Ground Floor Apartment Is Moving On Up
article_text:
A rising market lifts all units—even those on the ground floor.

Ground-floor apartments with private street entrances—dubbed maisonettes in real-estate speak—are fixtures of large, prewar Manhattan buildings. Often used as office space for doctors or dentists, and sometimes a few steps below ground, with security bars on their windows, they have long been viewed as the second-class citizens of upscale buildings.

Now,...

twitter.description: Long the dark abodes of doctors’ and dentists’ offices, Manhattan’s maisonettes are rebranded as coveted real estate
twitter.title: The Ground Floor Apartment Is Moving On Up

article_summary:
A rising market lifts all units—even those on the ground floor.
Often used as office space for doctors or dentists, and sometimes a few steps below ground, with security bars on their windows, they have long been viewed as the second-class citizens of upscale buildings.
Ground-floor apartments with private street entrances—dubbed maisonettes in real-estate speak—are fixtures of large, prewar Manhattan buildings.
